basics.name: Akshay K. Verma
basics.label: Semiconductor Materials Scientist
basics.summary: Semiconductor materials scientist specialising in III–V epitaxy using MBE, with a focus on quantum dots, nanostructures, and quantum photonic materials. I have delivered high-quality epitaxial wafers for research, industry, and national facilities, combining deep materials science expertise with hands-on reactor operation and data-driven optimisation.

work.name: National Epitaxy Facility, University of Sheffield
work.summary: MBE process and development engineer for III–V quantum photonic and optoelectronic structures.
highlights: Operate and develop processes on a DCA Dual-P700 MBE reactor for GaAs, AlGaAs, InGaAs, GaSb and related heterostructures.
Delivered >100 wafers for internal projects, UK users and industry partners with >95% reproducibility.
Optimised growth windows, interface quality and uniformity for quantum dot, quantum well and Bragg mirror structures.
Used AFM, XRD, photoluminescence and Hall measurements to drive data-informed process optimisation.
Supported troubleshooting (leaks, parasitic deposition, pressure instabilities) and routine reactor maintenance.
Additional MOVPE experience on Aixtron CCS 3×2" reactor for GaAs-, InP- and AlInP-based structures.

work.name: Paderborn University
work.summary: R&D on InAs quantum dots and quantum dot molecules for quantum photonics.
highlights: Developed MBE growth for InAs quantum dots and QD molecules embedded in GaAs/AlGaAs heterostructures.
Studied nucleation, strain and coupling effects to control emission wavelength and linewidth.
Collaborated with device and theory groups on quantum photonic applications and sample design.
Used AFM, PL and structural characterisation to connect growth parameters with optical properties.
